hr.p: Dear Ambridge Area School District Parent(s)/Guardian(s):

I hope this message finds you and your family well. Once again, I thank you for your patience and flexibility during these uncertain times. I understand that everyone is anxious about District planning as it pertains to end of the school year events, grading, and graduation. I will address those issues below and hopefully help ease some of the anxiety many families are having at this time.

Secondary Student Grading: The third nine weeks will end on 3/13/2020. If an assignment was made prior to 3/13/2020 and due on or before 3/13/2020, it will count as part of the third nine weeks grade. The last day for students to turn in assignments for the third nine weeks will be 4/24/2020. 4/24/2020 will be the official beginning of the fourth nine weeks. Any work submitted may only benefit a student’s grade. Students and parents should check their Tyler Portal to see if they have any missing assignments and email their teacher to make arrangements to complete their missing assignments.

At this point, students will not receive a grade for the fourth nine weeks. Participation is strongly encouraged in order to avoid learning gaps during the 2020-2021 academic year. Building principals in grades 6 through 12 are creating pathways for failing students to higher their overall grade by participating in the “Remote Learning Opportunities Program.” Participation is directly linked to attendance and this will be the primary basis for a failing student to earn a passing grade. Since the Ambridge Area School District is using “Remote Learning Opportunities,” synchronous attendance may not be prudent. Rather attendance could be based on asynchronous participation.
Credit Recovery: If a student was assigned a credit recovery opportunity prior to 3/13, they must complete this to receive the credit and it must be completed by 11:59 PM on or before 6/29/2020.

Elementary Student Grading: Elementary students will receive the grades for the third nine weeks they earned with the work they did up to the March 13 closure of school. At this point, students will not receive a grade for the fourth nine weeks. Participation is strongly encouraged in order to avoid learning gaps during the 2020-2021 academic year.

Graduation: Seniors, who have the qualifications to become graduates of Ambridge Area High School, will officially be classified as such on June 5, 2020. The Ambridge Area School District would prefer to have a live ceremony, if possible, later in the summer of 2020.

AAHS Student QPAs: If our Student Information System allows a blank fourth quarter grade, QPAs will be averaged using our traditional quartile system with the exception of the 4th Quarter of the current academic year. A Senior’s QPA would now be based on 15 Quarters instead of 16 Quarters. If our Student Information System does not allow a blank fourth quarter grade, an alternative solution will be implemented by the administration and we will let you know as soon as possible.
Senior Projects: Senior Project requirements will be waived as a board action.

Senior Keystone Remediation: Keystone Remediation requirements which are assigned to students who did not achieve a score of Advanced or Proficient on their Algebra or ELA Keystone State Assessments will be waived as a board action.

Prom: The Prom has been moved to Friday, June 26, 2020 (if permitted). The Prom will be held at the Pittsburgh Airport Marriott and will be proceeded in traditional fashion by the Grand March, which will be held at the Ambridge Area High School auditorium.

Access to Technology and Academic Materials: At this time the Ambridge Area School District will not be distributing electronic devices due to the COVID-19 pandemic. We are exercising an abundance of caution not to put our students, staff, and community in harm’s way.

Collection of Materials and Locker Cleanout: When the governor’s “Stay at Home Order” is lifted and the AASD Administration feels it is safe for students to re-enter the buildings, students will return to school. This date has yet to be determined. Students will clean their lockers/personal classroom areas and claim their personal belongings.

Please remember that the administration, faculty, and staff considerate their personal responsibility to make a positive impact on all of our students. We will do everything in our power to celebrate the accomplishments of our Senior Class. Stay healthy and safe.

p.span: Dear Ambridge Area School District Parents, Families, and Staff:

Thank you for your patience as we navigate how to effectively manage and engage our students during the closure of schools in the Ambridge Area School District. We continue to monitor the situation and wait for additional information from the Governor and the Pennsylvania Department of Education. We do not have a clear indication at this time whether the Governor will extend the mandatory shutdown. As a District and a county, we have decided to remain closed until April 13, 2020. In the next couple of weeks, County Superintendents will reevaluate the situation.

To keep students engaged during the closure, the District has developed and will continuously update a list of helpful resources that are available on our website. Currently, the District is giving its best effort to provide a continuous educational program for students that follows local, state, and federal guidelines. Several issues will need to be addressed before this plan comes to fruition. We know you have many questions and we will provide you with details as soon as possible. It is our hope that this message finds you healthy and safe. Once again, thank you for your patience.
Mr. Barry J. King
Substitute Superintendent
Ambridge Area School District

p.span: Update from Positive Steps:

span.span: During this crisis we are aware that many of our clients may be in need of therapy more than ever. WPPC has taken measures that will allow us to provide face to face therapy at either our Beaver or Baden office. Additionally, the PA Office of Mental Health and Substance Abuse Services (OMHSAS) has loosened the regulations around Telehealth during the COVID19 crisis which will allow our therapists to conduct therapy sessions via internet, Facetime or phone. Unfortunately, this only applies to clients whose primary insurance is Medical Assistance. None of the commercial insurances have followed suit. We will be contacting clients and/or their parents/guardians to offer these services.

Kennywood ticket sales in the District were scheduled for Tuesday March 24th. This has been cancelled. Please see the below message from Kennywood.
Dear Kennywood Coordinator,

We know the Coronavirus situation has been at the top of everyone’s mind of late, and it has been at Kennywood as well. The health and safety of our Guests and Team Members is always our top priority, and our team has been proactive in enhancing cleaning, sanitation, and disinfection protocols for our Team Members currently working, and in preparing for when the park opens for the 2020 Summer Season.

p.style: margin-bottom: 4.5pt; background: white; orphans: 2; text-align: start; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px;
p.span: At this time, we continue to plan towards the start of the Kennywood season on Saturday, May 2. We will continue our careful monitoring of the current situation, adhering strictly to the recommendations from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, as well as our local and statewide health and safety agencies.

span.span: However, Kennywood management has made the decision to cancel ALL in-school ticket sales for 2020. We will not be rescheduling any ticket sale dates. Your school district’s picnic tickets will still be available on the personalized URL that you were assigned. We are adjusting the price online to meet the same value as a ticket sold at the school. In the occasion that Kennywood does not proceed with its current operating schedule, I will be in contact with the affected district to reschedule a picnic date.

span.style: color: #050505; font-family: verdana, geneva; font-size: 12pt; white-space: pre-wrap;
